pageContext.claim: “They [Germany] don't treat us right, they don't pay their bills, they're delinquent. You know what delinquent is? They're delinquent. They don't pay their bills. We protect them; they don't pay their bills.”
pageContext.analysis: Since 2006, each NATO member has had a guideline of spending at least 2 percent of gross domestic product on defense spending, with a goal of reaching that level by 2024. Germany is not making payments to NATO and thus is not "delinquent" in payments to NATO.
